decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal damage swiftly to the opponent. Supporting spells like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison provide additional damage and control options. The inclusion of cards like Flooded Strand and Windswept Heath allows for efficient mana fixing and thinning of the deck. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of powerful creatures and versatile spells to secure a fast victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and graveyard manipulation. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Graveyard Trespasser. With support from cards like Thought Scour and Unearth, the deck can efficiently fill the graveyard and take advantage of graveyard synergies. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combination of Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to repeatedly mill cards and recur key pieces from the graveyard, ultimately leading to a win condition with Thassa's Oracle. It also includes various artifact cards such as Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to help fuel the combo engine. By carefully sequencing plays and managing resources, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talismans, while controlling the board with removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble. It aims to eventually cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to overwhelm the opponent. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and disruption, while Sowing Mycospawn and Nulldrifter offer card advantage. The deck also includes lands that provide color fixing and additional ramp, allowing for a consistent and powerful late-game threat.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly assemble the combo of Amulet Titan. By utilizing bounce lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber along with Amulet of Vigor, the deck is able to generate a lot of mana and play Primeval Titan early in the game. The win condition is usually achieved by fetching lands like Vesuva and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with Primeval Titan, allowing for a powerful combo finish with multiple copies of Valakut in play.

This deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to combo off and generate infinite mana and card advantage through Emry, Lurker of the Loch and various zero-cost artifacts. It aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces using Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Preordain to filter through the deck, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with Sink into Stupor and Malevolent Rumble. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts like Grinding Station and Mox Opal. Ultimately, the goal is to create a loop that leads to a win condition like Grapeshot or decking the opponent.

Utilizing ramp spells and mana rocks, this deck aims to quickly accelerate into casting powerful Eldrazi creatures. With control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck can disrupt opponents while establishing a board presence. Key threats include Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, while Sowing Mycospawn provides additional value and disruption. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistently casting Eldrazi creatures, with lands that generate colorless mana and fix mana for all Eldrazi spells.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the game with removal spells and Karn, the Great Creator. By utilizing cards like Utopia Sprawl, Talisman of Impulse, and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to quickly get out threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the battlefield. Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble provide board control, while Karn, the Great Creator can shut down the opponent's artifacts. Overall, the deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize combo pieces like Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Urza's Saga to cycle through the deck quickly and create a powerful board state. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and help dig for key pieces, while Malevolent Rumble and Unholy Heat offer removal and disruption. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly to win the game through a powerful sequence of plays, ultimately culminating in a game-winning finisher like Thassa's Oracle.

This deck focuses on utilizing land ramp and bouncing lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to search for and play Primeval Titan, which can search for powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva. With the ability to tutor for important cards and generate mana efficiently, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a powerful board presence and win the game quickly.

The main goal of this deck is to utilize the Underworld Breach combo to create powerful loops and generate infinite value. By combining cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Mishra's Bauble, and Grinding Station, the deck aims to mill out the opponent or use Thassa's Oracle to win the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mox Amber help to generate additional card advantage and mana to fuel the combo. With careful sequencing and resource management, this deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its synergies.

The deck aims to utilize the Underworld Breach combo, along with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to create a loop that allows for infinite mana or decking out opponents. The deck also includes various artifact and spell synergies, as well as disruption in the form of Malevolent Rumble and Unholy Heat. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and filtering, while Thassa's Oracle serves as a win condition. The deck is focused on chaining together spells and artifacts to quickly assemble the combo and win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful combo pieces like Disrupting Shoal, Goblin Charbelcher, and Lotus Bloom to quickly assemble a winning board state. By utilizing cards like Beyeen Veil and Tameshi, Reality Architect, the deck can control the game and protect its key pieces. Whir of Invention and Thundertrap Trainer offer further ways to search for combo pieces, while Flare of Denial and Spell Snare provide disruption against opposing strategies. With an aggressive tempo and the ability to quickly assemble game-ending combos, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using talismans and Utopia Sprawl to bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements like Kozilek's Return and Karn, the Great Creator help disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Malevolent Rumble provide additional removal options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large creatures and control the board with various spell options. It also includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Cavern of Souls to support the Eldrazi strategy.

The key concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to use a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing versatile cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck aims to apply early pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Fatal Push and Malevolent Rumble. By combining aggressive threats with disruptive elements, this deck aims to dictate the pace of the game and come out on top in one-on-one matchups.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to use a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage to control the opponent's board and hand while deploying threatening creatures to close out the game. By disrupting the opponent's game plan and controlling the tempo of the game, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until it can secure a victory. The deck also includes graveyard hate and flexible removal options to handle a variety of threats, making it a versatile and powerful control option in the Modern format.
